titles.title: Granting the consent of Congress to the Missouri-Nebraska Boundary Compact.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 106-303.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 181.

action.text: Mr. Gekas moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 54.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Constitution, Federalism, Property.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Hatch without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 389.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 5/12/1999--Introduced. Grants the consent of Congress to the Missouri-Nebraska Boundary Compact entered into between Missouri and Nebraska the principal purpose of which is to establish an identifiable compromise boundary between such States without interfering with or otherwise affecting private property rights or titles to property.
